poemContent:
Of all the public places, dear,
to chose to piss, I've chosen here,
on your doorstep, under the stars,
or behind the doors of parked-up cars,
No, your doorstep truly rules,
as the perfect toilet stool.

For number 1, I can chose the foot of your door,
For number 2, go inside, and on your floor,
For number 3, I'll climb up your chimney, and pee
all over your carpets.

I bought lemonade with your kind coppers,
that was big of you.
The soles of your shoes are wet now,
that's piss for you.
